result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaru A. Watson

records.addlTxt: State's First Amended List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery

09:00 AM
Defendant Jaru A. Watson appeared with Attorney Xavier Solis.  Defendant in custody.
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.
Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Matter not resolved, def. atty requesting trial date.
Set over for trial, bond continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury selection scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jaru A. Watson appeared with Attorney Xavier Solis.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Solis. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered by the Court. . Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

229PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Xavier Solis.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am. before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  Bond continued as previously set.  ts

Defendant Jaru A. Watson appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Corcoran moves to withdraw due to conflict; Court grants request.  Atty Corcoran notified SPD of need to reappoint.     DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:39 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued as previously set.  ts
for Dismissal filed by the Defendant.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jaru A. Watson in court, in custody.  Intern Sydney Star with Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No firearms.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Michael B, Jr.

01:16 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Bub.
